trans-unit.source: Develop C# Hadoop streaming programs for HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Develop C# Hadoop streaming programs for HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to develop Hadoop streaming MapReduce programs in C#, and how to deploy them to Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to develop Hadoop streaming MapReduce programs in C#, and how to deploy them to Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Develop C# Hadoop streaming programs for HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Develop C# Hadoop streaming programs for HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Hadoop provides a streaming API for MapReduce that enables you to write map and reduce functions in languages other than Java.
trans-unit.target: Hadoop provides a streaming API for MapReduce that enables you to write map and reduce functions in languages other than Java.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through creating a C# word-count program, which counts the occurrences of a given word in the input data you provide.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through creating a C# word-count program, which counts the occurrences of a given word in the input data you provide.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration shows how the MapReduce framework does a word count:
trans-unit.target: The following illustration shows how the MapReduce framework does a word count:

trans-unit.source: HDI.WordCountDiagram
trans-unit.target: HDI.WordCountDiagram

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article apply only to Windows-based Azure HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article apply only to Windows-based Azure HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For an example of streaming for Linux-based HDInsight, see [Develop Python streaming programs for HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-streaming-python.md).
trans-unit.target: For an example of streaming for Linux-based HDInsight, see [Develop Python streaming programs for HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-streaming-python.md).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to:

trans-unit.source: Develop and test a Hadoop streaming MapReduce program by using C# on the HDInsight Emulator for Azure
trans-unit.target: Develop and test a Hadoop streaming MapReduce program by using C# on the HDInsight Emulator for Azure

trans-unit.source: Run the same MapReduce job on Azure HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Run the same MapReduce job on Azure HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the results of the MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the results of the MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have done the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have done the following:

trans-unit.source: Install the HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: Install the HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Get started using HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-get-started-emulator].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Get started using HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-get-started-emulator].

trans-unit.source: Install Azure PowerShell on the emulator computer.
trans-unit.target: Install Azure PowerShell on the emulator computer.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install].

trans-unit.source: Obtain an Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Obtain an Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Purchase Options][azure-purchase-options], [Member Offers][azure-member-offers], or [Free Trial][azure-free-trial].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Purchase Options][azure-purchase-options], [Member Offers][azure-member-offers], or [Free Trial][azure-free-trial].

trans-unit.source: Develop a word-count Hadoop streaming program in C#
trans-unit.target: Develop a word-count Hadoop streaming program in C#

trans-unit.source: The word-count solution contains two console application projects: mapper and reducer.
trans-unit.target: The word-count solution contains two console application projects: mapper and reducer.

trans-unit.source: The mapper application streams each word into the console, and the reducer application counts the number of words that are streamed from a document.
trans-unit.target: The mapper application streams each word into the console, and the reducer application counts the number of words that are streamed from a document.

trans-unit.source: Both the mapper and the reducer read characters, line by line, from the standard input stream (stdin) and write to the standard output stream (stdout).
trans-unit.target: Both the mapper and the reducer read characters, line by line, from the standard input stream (stdin) and write to the standard output stream (stdout).

trans-unit.source: To create a C# console application
trans-unit.target: To create a C# console application

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: Click **FILE**, click **New**, and then click **Project**.
trans-unit.target: Click **FILE**, click **New**, and then click **Project**.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Template
trans-unit.target: Template

trans-unit.source: Visual C#/Windows/Console Application
trans-unit.target: Visual C#/Windows/Console Application

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: WordCountMapper
trans-unit.target: WordCountMapper

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: C:\Tutorials
trans-unit.target: C:\Tutorials

trans-unit.source: Solution name
trans-unit.target: Solution name

trans-unit.source: WordCount
trans-unit.target: WordCount

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to create the project.

trans-unit.source: To create the mapper program
trans-unit.target: To create the mapper program

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click **Program.cs**, and then click **Rename**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click **Program.cs**, and then click **Rename**.

trans-unit.source: Rename the file to **WordCountMapper.cs**, and then press **ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Rename the file to **WordCountMapper.cs**, and then press **ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Yes** to confirm renaming all references.
trans-unit.target: Click **Yes** to confirm renaming all references.

trans-unit.source: Double-click **WordCountMapper.cs** to open it.
trans-unit.target: Double-click **WordCountMapper.cs** to open it.

trans-unit.source: Add the following **using** statement:
trans-unit.target: Add the following **using** statement:

trans-unit.source: Replace the **Main()** function with the following:
trans-unit.target: Replace the **Main()** function with the following:

trans-unit.source: Click **BUILD**, and then click **Build Solution** to compile the mapper program.
trans-unit.target: Click **BUILD**, and then click **Build Solution** to compile the mapper program.

trans-unit.source: To create the reducer program
trans-unit.target: To create the reducer program

trans-unit.source: From Visual Studio 2013, click **FILE**, click **Add**, and then click **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: From Visual Studio 2013, click **FILE**, click **Add**, and then click **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values:

trans-unit.target: Visual C#/Windows/Console Application

trans-unit.target: WordCountReducer

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: C:\Tutorials\WordCount
trans-unit.target: C:\Tutorials\WordCount

trans-unit.source: Clear the check box to **Create directory for solution**, and then click **OK** to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Clear the check box to **Create directory for solution**, and then click **OK** to create the project.

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, right-click **Program.cs**, and then click **Rename**.
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, right-click **Program.cs**, and then click **Rename**.

trans-unit.source: Rename the file to **WordCountReducer.cs**, and then press **ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Rename the file to **WordCountReducer.cs**, and then press **ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Yes** to confirm renaming all references.
trans-unit.target: Click **Yes** to confirm renaming all references.

trans-unit.source: Double-click **WordCountReducer.cs** to open it.
trans-unit.target: Double-click **WordCountReducer.cs** to open it.

trans-unit.target: Click **BUILD**, and then click **Build Solution** to compile the reducer program.

trans-unit.source: The mapper and reducer executables are located at:
trans-unit.target: The mapper and reducer executables are located at:

trans-unit.source: C:\Tutorials\WordCount\WordCountMapper\bin\Debug\WordCountMapper.exe
trans-unit.target: C:\Tutorials\WordCount\WordCountMapper\bin\Debug\WordCountMapper.exe

trans-unit.source: C:\Tutorials\WordCount\WordCountReducer\bin\Debug\WordCountReducer.exe
trans-unit.target: C:\Tutorials\WordCount\WordCountReducer\bin\Debug\WordCountReducer.exe

trans-unit.target: Upload the mapper and reducer applications to the emulator's file system

trans-unit.source: By default, HDInsight emulator uses Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) as the file system.
trans-unit.target: By default, HDInsight emulator uses Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) as the file system.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can configure the HDInsight Emulator to use Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can configure the HDInsight Emulator to use Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Get started with HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-emulator-wasb].
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Get started with HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-emulator-wasb].

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will use the HDFS **copyFromLocal** command to upload the files.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will use the HDFS **copyFromLocal** command to upload the files.

trans-unit.source: The next section shows you how to upload files by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The next section shows you how to upload files by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For other methods, see [Upload data to HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data].
trans-unit.target: For other methods, see [Upload data to HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the following folder structure:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the following folder structure:

trans-unit.source: Folder
trans-unit.target: Folder

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: \WordCount
trans-unit.target: \WordCount

trans-unit.source: The root folder for the word-count project.
trans-unit.target: The root folder for the word-count project.

trans-unit.source: \WordCount\Apps
trans-unit.target: \WordCount\Apps

trans-unit.source: The folder for the mapper and reducer executables.
trans-unit.target: The folder for the mapper and reducer executables.

trans-unit.source: \WordCount\Input
trans-unit.target: \WordCount\Input

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce source file folder.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce source file folder.

trans-unit.source: \WordCount\Output
trans-unit.target: \WordCount\Output

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce output file folder.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce output file folder.

trans-unit.source: \WordCount\MRStatusOutput
trans-unit.target: \WordCount\MRStatusOutput

trans-unit.source: The job output folder.
trans-unit.target: The job output folder.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the .txt files located in the %hadoop_home% directory.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the .txt files located in the %hadoop_home% directory.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hadoop HDFS commands are case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hadoop HDFS commands are case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: To run the MapReduce job by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: To run the MapReduce job by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Open Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install].

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to set variables:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to set variables:

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight emulator cluster name is "http://localhost:50111".
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight emulator cluster name is "http://localhost:50111".

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to define the streaming job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to define the streaming job:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to create a credential object:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to create a credential object:

trans-unit.source: You will get a prompt to enter the password.
trans-unit.target: You will get a prompt to enter the password.

trans-unit.source: The password can be any string.
trans-unit.target: The password can be any string.

trans-unit.source: The user name must be "hadoop".
trans-unit.target: The user name must be "hadoop".

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to submit the MapReduce job and wait for the job to finish:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to submit the MapReduce job and wait for the job to finish:

trans-unit.source: When the job finishes, you will get an output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When the job finishes, you will get an output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: You can see the job ID in the output, for example, *job-201311132317-0034*.
trans-unit.target: You can see the job ID in the output, for example, *job-201311132317-0034*.

trans-unit.source: To check the job status
trans-unit.target: To check the job status

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, click **Hadoop YARN Status**, or browse to **http://localhost:50030/jobtracker.jsp**.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, click **Hadoop YARN Status**, or browse to **http://localhost:50030/jobtracker.jsp**.

trans-unit.source: Find the job by using the job ID under either the **RUNNING** or **FINISHED** category.
trans-unit.target: Find the job by using the job ID under either the **RUNNING** or **FINISHED** category.

trans-unit.source: If a job failed, you can find it under the **FAILED** category.
trans-unit.target: If a job failed, you can find it under the **FAILED** category.

trans-unit.source: You can also open the job details and find some helpful information for debugging.
trans-unit.target: You can also open the job details and find some helpful information for debugging.

trans-unit.source: To display the output from HDFS
trans-unit.target: To display the output from HDFS

trans-unit.source: Open the Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: Open the Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to display the output:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to display the output:

trans-unit.source: You can append "|more" at the end of the command to get the page view.
trans-unit.target: You can append "|more" at the end of the command to get the page view.

trans-unit.source: Upload data to Azure Blob storage
trans-unit.target: Upload data to Azure Blob storage

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: You can configure an HDInsight cluster to use additional Blob storage for the data files.
trans-unit.target: You can configure an HDInsight cluster to use additional Blob storage for the data files.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will create an Azure Storage account and upload the data files to the Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will create an Azure Storage account and upload the data files to the Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The data files are the .txt files in the %hadoop_home%\share\doc\hadoop\common directory.
trans-unit.target: The data files are the .txt files in the %hadoop_home%\share\doc\hadoop\common directory.

trans-unit.source: To create a Storage account and a container
trans-unit.target: To create a Storage account and a container

trans-unit.source: Open Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Set the variables, and then run the commands:
trans-unit.target: Set the variables, and then run the commands:

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to create a Storage account and a Blob storage container on the account:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to create a Storage account and a Blob storage container on the account:

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to verify the Storage account and the container:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to verify the Storage account and the container:

trans-unit.source: To upload the data files
trans-unit.target: To upload the data files

trans-unit.source: In the Azure PowerShell window, set the values for the local and destination folders:
trans-unit.target: In the Azure PowerShell window, set the values for the local and destination folders:

trans-unit.source: Notice the local source file folder is **C:\hdp\hadoop-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981\share\doc\hadoop\common**, and the destination folder is **WordCount/Input**.
trans-unit.target: Notice the local source file folder is **C:\hdp\hadoop-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981\share\doc\hadoop\common**, and the destination folder is **WordCount/Input**.

trans-unit.source: The source location is the location of the .txt files on the HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: The source location is the location of the .txt files on the HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: The destination is the folder structure that will be reflected under the Azure Blob container.
trans-unit.target: The destination is the folder structure that will be reflected under the Azure Blob container.

trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to get a list of the .txt files in the source file folder:

trans-unit.target: Run the following command to list the uploaded files:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure PowerShell window, set the following variables:
trans-unit.target: In the Azure PowerShell window, set the following variables:

trans-unit.target: Notice the destination folder is **WordCount/Apps**, which is the structure that will be reflected in the Azure Blob container.

trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to copy the applications:

trans-unit.target: Run the following command to list the uploaded files:

trans-unit.target: You shall see both application files listed there.

trans-unit.source: Run the MapReduce job on Azure HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Run the MapReduce job on Azure HDInsight

trans-unit.source: This section provides an Azure PowerShell script that performs all the tasks related to running a MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: This section provides an Azure PowerShell script that performs all the tasks related to running a MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: The list of tasks includes:
trans-unit.target: The list of tasks includes:

trans-unit.source: Provision an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Provision an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Create a Storage account that will be used as the default HDInsight cluster file system
trans-unit.target: Create a Storage account that will be used as the default HDInsight cluster file system

trans-unit.source: Create a Blob storage container
trans-unit.target: Create a Blob storage container

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Submit the MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: Submit the MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Create a streaming MapReduce job definition
trans-unit.target: Create a streaming MapReduce job definition

trans-unit.source: Submit a MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: Submit a MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Wait for the job to finish
trans-unit.target: Wait for the job to finish

trans-unit.source: Display standard error
trans-unit.target: Display standard error

trans-unit.source: Display standard output
trans-unit.target: Display standard output

trans-unit.source: Delete the cluster
trans-unit.target: Delete the cluster

trans-unit.source: Delete the HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Delete the HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Delete the Storage account used as the default HDInsight cluster file system
trans-unit.target: Delete the Storage account used as the default HDInsight cluster file system

trans-unit.source: To run the Azure PowerShell script
trans-unit.target: To run the Azure PowerShell script

trans-unit.source: Open Notepad.
trans-unit.target: Open Notepad.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the following code:
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the following code:

trans-unit.source: Set the first four variables in the script.
trans-unit.target: Set the first four variables in the script.

trans-unit.source: The **$stringPrefix** variable is used to prefix the specified string to the HDInsight cluster name, the Storage account name, and the Blob storage container name.
trans-unit.target: The **$stringPrefix** variable is used to prefix the specified string to the HDInsight cluster name, the Storage account name, and the Blob storage container name.

trans-unit.source: Because the names for these must be 3 to 24 characters, make sure the string you specify and the names this script uses, together, do not exceed the character limit for the name.
trans-unit.target: Because the names for these must be 3 to 24 characters, make sure the string you specify and the names this script uses, together, do not exceed the character limit for the name.

trans-unit.source: You must use all lowercase for **$stringPrefix**.
trans-unit.target: You must use all lowercase for **$stringPrefix**.

trans-unit.source: The **$storageAccountName_Data** and **$containerName_Data** variables are the Storage account and container that you already created in the previous steps.
trans-unit.target: The **$storageAccountName_Data** and **$containerName_Data** variables are the Storage account and container that you already created in the previous steps.

trans-unit.source: So, you must provide the names for those.
trans-unit.target: So, you must provide the names for those.

trans-unit.source: These are used for storing the data files and the applications.
trans-unit.target: These are used for storing the data files and the applications.

trans-unit.source: The **$location** variable must match the data storage account location.
trans-unit.target: The **$location** variable must match the data storage account location.

trans-unit.source: Review the rest of the variables.
trans-unit.target: Review the rest of the variables.

trans-unit.source: Save the script file.
trans-unit.target: Save the script file.

trans-unit.source: Open Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to set the execution policy to RemoteSigned:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to set the execution policy to RemoteSigned:

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the user name and password for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the user name and password for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the password is at least 10 characters and contains one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, a number, and a special character.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the password is at least 10 characters and contains one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, a number, and a special character.

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to get prompted for the credentials, see [Working with Passwords, Secure Strings and Credentials in Windows PowerShell][powershell-PSCredential].
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to get prompted for the credentials, see [Working with Passwords, Secure Strings and Credentials in Windows PowerShell][powershell-PSCredential].

trans-unit.source: For an HDInsight .NET SDK sample on submitting Hadoop streaming jobs, see [Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically][hdinsight-submit-jobs].
trans-unit.target: For an HDInsight .NET SDK sample on submitting Hadoop streaming jobs, see [Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically][hdinsight-submit-jobs].

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the MapReduce job output
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the MapReduce job output

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to download and display the output.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to download and display the output.

trans-unit.source: For information on displaying the results in Excel, see [Connect Excel to HDInsight with the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver][hdinsight-ODBC] and [Connect Excel to HDInsight with Power Query][hdinsight-power-query].
trans-unit.target: For information on displaying the results in Excel, see [Connect Excel to HDInsight with the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver][hdinsight-ODBC] and [Connect Excel to HDInsight with Power Query][hdinsight-power-query].

trans-unit.source: To retrieve the output
trans-unit.target: To retrieve the output

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell window.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell window.

trans-unit.source: Set the values, and then run the commands:

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you have learned how to develop a Hadoop streaming MapReduce job, how to test the application on the HDInsight Emulator, and how to write an Azure PowerShell script to provision an HDInsight cluster and run a MapReduce job on the cluster.
